Split survey column

Source: R/load.R
split_survey_column.Rd

Splits a composite survey/filename column into parts by a separator and extracts the plot identifier. The default format from GPR software is e.g. "Survey_2024.10.29_001_A_converted" where the plot ID is the 4th part (here: "A").

Usage

split_survey_column(
  df,
  survey_col = "Survey",
  sep = "_",
  plot_position = 4,
  plot_name = "PLOT_ID",
  drop_original = TRUE
)

Arguments

df

A data.frame.

survey_col

Name of the column to split. Default "Survey".

sep

Separator string. Default "_".

plot_position

Which part (after split) contains the plot ID. Default 4.

plot_name

Name for the new plot column. Default "PLOT_ID".

drop_original

Drop the original survey column? Default TRUE.

Value

A data.frame with a new plot column.

On this page

Developed by Jakub Miszczyszyn & Luiza Tymińska-Czabańska at the Faculty of Forestry, University of Agriculture in Krakow. Funded by NCN (National Science Centre, Poland).
